Fortunately, he had been kept sedated the whole time he was on the machines as he was terrified of them. My brother and I made the decision that it was only right to pull the venilator and let nature take its course. Anytime he seemed to rouse or be in pain, morphine was administered to keep him comfortable. We sat there for an agonizing 2 hours, holding his hands and staring at him. It was the most painful decision I have ever had to make but it was the right one.
